unnormalised: Waste management in India is a HUGE challenge, right? From overflowing landfills in Delhi to plastic choking the beaches of Goa, we see the impact everywhere. But it's not all doom and gloom – we, as individuals, can actually make a real difference!
normalised: so what can you i and sharmaji next door do first off seriously consider segregation at source separate your wet waste vegetable peels food scraps for composting maybe even start a small compost pit in your balcony or garden like my auntie did in her bangalore apartment it is easier than you think

unnormalised: So, what can you, I, and Sharmaji next door do? First off, seriously consider segregation at source. Separate your wet waste (vegetable peels, food scraps) for composting. Maybe even start a small compost pit in your balcony or garden like my Auntie did in her Bangalore apartment. It’s easier than you think!
